nodes.title: General site characteristics
nodes.body: Ukpalung Doring’Ug pa lung rdo ring is situated on level, sandy ground in the middle of the north-south running Ukpa Lung’Ug pa lung valley. The site is obscured by much dramagra ma brush growth. Ukpalung Doring’Ug pa lung rdo ring is in eyeshot of the great citadel of Wangchuk Gönpo KharDbang phyug mgon po mkhar (A-51). In the pre-modern period it was used to enshrine Manima ṇi plaques, some of which are still intact. The enclosure was constructed primarily of white granite cobbles and does not appear to have been well aligned in the compass points. Except for the relatively intact south wall, only small fragments of the enclosure have survived. The enclosure measures 7.5 m (north-south) x 9.5 m (east-west). There appear to be seven pillars clustered near he west end of the enclosure, of which, all but two of them have been broken. The two tallest specimens measure 1.1 m (height) x 1.4 m (basal girth) x 8 cm (thickness) and 1 m x 1.3 m x 20 cm. The next tallest specimen (75 cm) is also tabular. The other broken pillars are significantly shorter. Broken parts of pillars and other stones are heaped around the in situ menhirs.
